Scheme 1: Introduction. (A) Previous work: electrochemical oxidation enables 1,3-difunctionalization of cyclopropanes. (B) This work: electrochemical-induced 1,3-oxohydroxylation of arylcyclopropanes
Scheme 2: Scope of the 1,3-oxohydroxylation of arylcyclopropanes.[a]Reaction conditions: carbon cloth anode, Pt plate cathode, constant current=20 mA, cyclopropane (0.2 mmol),nBu4NClO4(0.2 mmol), H2O (0.1 mL), HFIP (0.4 mL), CH3COCH3(5.5 mL), 50 °C, undivided cell under Ar. Isolated yields were shown.[b]H2O (0.1 mL), HOAc (0.2 mL), CH3COCH3(5.7 mL) were used.[c]H2O (0.1 mL), HOAc (0.2 mL), CH3COCH3(5.7 mL),nBu4NBF4(0.2 mmol) were used.[d]H2O (0.1 mL), HFIP (0.4 mL), CH3COCH3(5.5 mL), DDQ (0.04 mmol) were used.
